statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -15 \\ -3 \\ -11 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -33 \\ -3 \\ -17 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -4 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -15 \\ -3 \\ -11 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -33 \\ -3 \\ -17 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -4 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
